text.p: These are the leading stories in the Namibian press on Friday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- The Ministry of Basic Education and Culture has imposed an age restriction and higher minimum requirements for entry to Grade 11, resulting in a reduced intake of only 55.5 percent of those who sat their National Junior Secondary Certificate examinations this year.

- The Namibian economy could return to single digit average yearly inflation according to the November Interim Consumer Price Index. The CPI released on Thursday calculates annual inflation in the 12 months up to November this year as 8.64 percent.
- Pupils above the age of 22 will not be able to enter Grade 11 from next year.
